text: Jesus. Ian Duke said the original version of  Unesh had a white activated ability that said whenever a sphinx attacks pay W and you can [[Meddling Mage]] an opponent.

text: That would have been so baller!
But the card would be tied to that sphinx so you'd have to track which sphinx named which card. Could get ugly.
Unless they were all tied to Unesh. Either way. Yuck.
Everyone who played against in within WotC hated it and begged them not to publish it that way.
It's was Ken Nagle's brainchild and he's a known griefer.
Lol, is he? They should have just made it Unesh attacking, if each Sphinx was too much

Or "whenever one or more sphinges you control attack you may pay W. If you do each opponent reveals a card from his or her hand at random. Until your next turn opponents can't play cards with the name of a card revealed this way."
That sounds like fun for everyone, right?
Shit u
Shut up Dean, is what I meant.
Everyone knows you spell "Fun" "A-Z-O-R-I-U-S."
"shit u" is my new come back.
Shit u is the new covfefe
I shit u not
Shit u covfefe
Stop that shitting.
Make America Shit Again.
Is that how Trump is going to make us tired of winning?
Never get tired of shitting.
ABS: Always be shitting

Ok, perhaps the only time this becomes a relevant reference, but comix fans should check out Chester Brown's Ed the Happy Clown. It's a fantastically subversive series from 1992 that follows the misadventures of a hapless clown as he encounters vampires, vampire hunters, interdimensional invasions and is afflicted with Ronald Reagan's head on the end of his penis.
The relevance is there is a story within titled "The Man Who Couldn't Stop Shitting".
<https://www.drawnandquarterly.com/ed-the-happy-clown>

attachments.title: Ed the Happy Clown
attachments.fallback: Drawn & Quarterly: Ed the Happy Clown

text: Rofl
The first scene is Ed walking down the street, happy to visit the sick children at the hospital when suddenly his leg spontaneously breaks and he is set upon by sewer rats.
Such a good book...everyone go buy a copy, sick back with a beverage and prepare of pure entertainment.
or sit back...
whichever works for you.

text: Family Vacation across the multiverse
but like you mentioned in the podcast, I'm not sure if I can do it without white.
or green for that matter haha.
General Tazri's Gonna Turn This Car Around!
definately going to use that line.
I have trouble not running a synergistic general.
That was the name of the deck, so you can be 5 colors :wink:
Meh...look at the general as a crutch.
You definitely need blue and green
take the chalenge!
challenge
Everything else is optional
Green gives you untaps and Burgeoning, but I don't think you have to treat the deck as a recreation of a regular turn.
what you really need is something that stops you from getting focused. [[Chronomantic Escape]], [[Solitary Confinement]], [[Delaying Shield]], etc.

attachments.fallback: Chronomantic Escape {4}{W}{W} // Sorcery // Until your next turn, creatures can't attack you. Exile Chronomantic Escape with three time counters on it. // Suspend 3—{2}{W} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {2}{W} and exile it with three time counters on it.
